  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42107].
  {panel}

I suggest that there should be a scoop of custom fields that can be enabled to be managed by users within the project administrators role only.

Fields like:
Select List cascading
Select list multiple choices
Select list single choices

In the above fields the project administrator should be able to setup the options and the default value.

The fields should have a tick-box for enabling the function for project administrators. If box is unticked the fields should be looked except for jira administrators.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42098].
  {panel}

We were using jira.atlassian.com REST API to load some test JIRA data in our eazyBI reporting application and we were using REST API with HTTP Basic authentication (as otherwise some APIs like "user" failed with 401 Unauthorized error) and using our jira.atlassian.com username and password. At least still on January 30, 2015 it was working.

But couple days ago we discovered that simple https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/latest/serverInfo with my username and password in HTTP Basic authentication header returns 403 Forbidden response.

If I try another Atlassian JIRA site, for example, https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/rest/api/latest/serverInfo with HTTP Basic authentication then it still works.

What has changed in jira.atlassian.com authentication in recent weeks and why Basic authentication is not working anymore?
fields.summary: HTTP Basic authentication not working anymore for jira.atlassian.com REST API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42097].
  {panel}

The _Summary_, _Description_ and other fields (e.g. Custom Fields) are no longer visible in the JIRA Issue Collector when using IE 9. 

h4. Error(s):
In console
{code}
SCRIPT16389: Unspecified error. 
batch.js?locale=en-US, line 545 character 140
{code}

h4. Steps To Recreate
# Install VirtualBox
# Windows 7 With IE 9
# Open Page

h4. Attempted Solution(s)
Using "Standards Mode"
Displaying in Compatibility Mode
Suggestions listed [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Layout+Broken+in+JIRA+6.x+in+Internet+Explorer]

h4. Workaround
Works in other browsers such as IE11 (without compatibility mode), Chrome, Firefox

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42095].

There are time when I want to enter a number of specific log lines, json snippets or other information in a bug.  The form entry can be a little cumbersome.  It would be nice if you allowed the form to be wider than the fixed width you give it.  

Either
- If I drag the textarea region wider, allow the area to expand (currently its max width and won't be allowed to be wider)
- if I make the browser window wide, let the form fill the region of width instead of staying a fixed width

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42092].
  {panel}

The importWorklog method of DefaultJiraDataImporter makes a call to
 
worklogManager.create(userProvider.getUser(externalWorklog.getAuthor()), worklog, null, false);

The method adds worklog to issue worklog and also adds an item to the history table. The worklog item is ok:

guena logged work - 01/Sep/14 8:01 PM 

Time Spent:2 hours 
Validate

However, the corresponding history item is not ok:

guena made changes - 8 hours ago 

Time Spent  3 hours, 5 minutes [ 11100 ]  5 hours, 5 minutes [ 18300 ]  
Worklog Id  11202 [ 11202 ]  

It should be like

guena made changes  01/Sep/14 8:01 PM 

Time Spent  3 hours, 5 minutes [ 11100 ]  5 hours, 5 minutes [ 18300 ]  
Worklog Id  11202 [ 11202 ]
fields.summary: worklogManager uses current date\time instead of supplied one for history

fields.description:
When issue creation is failed, the next issue successfully created has the incremented issue key.

h5. Steps to reproduce:
*The last issue-key created is TEST-16*
# Create issue (for example: with 4 bytes character). This will cause the issue creation to be failed.
# Create issue again. This time the issue creation is successful. 

h5. Expected Result
The expected issue key should be *TEST-17*. 

h5. Actual result
- But it will have *TEST-18* as issue key.
- When we browse the issue *TEST-17*, it will return error saying *The issue you are trying to view does not exist*. 
- In the database, there is no issue for issue key *TEST-17*

This happens with *MySQL database*
fields.summary: When issue creation is failed, the next issue successfully created has the incremented issue key (with MySQL database)

fields.description:
I have configured OpenLDAP as a user directory. As the default the synchronization interval is 60 minutes. 

This synchronizes well manually. However my directory did not synchronize automatically.

After I changed the synchronization interval to be 15 minutes, the directory did synchronize automatically. 

My Jira version: (v6.3.8#6338-sha1:68f19fa)

Note that I observed the same for Stash v3.4.0 when syncing to a Jira User Directory.
fields.summary: Default interval for LDAP synchronization does not work

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42087].
  {panel}

Customer Feedback:

For certain [Workflow Properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Workflow+Properties].
The name and action do not match, making it unclear on when and when not to use.
In example:
jira.permission.worklogeditall and jira.permission.worklogdeleteall 

{quote}
1)jira.issue.editable ---> disable editing action on issue. This is OK.
2)jira.permission.work.denied --> disable new log works on issue. This is OK
But
3) jira.permission.worklogeditall and jira.permission.worklogdeleteall --> by the name I expect that it should disable/enable work log editing/deleting, however these both properties deny the access to work log tab.
The property name does not match the action specified in property's name.
{quote}

Kind Regards,

Ibrahim
fields.summary: Ability to disable log work adding and editing on specific issue or on specific issue status.

fields.description:
When user gets created in jira or user's group membership is changed, jira internally relies on cached ldap data. It causes problems if cache is out sync with ldap directory (by default cache is refreshed every 30 minutes).

Scenario: Exception is thrown during user creation
Let's assume that the default group is "jira-users" and it exists in the local cached version of ldap directory, however it has been deleted from the remote ldap server (so local cache is out of sync). When adding an user, jira will instruct remote ldap server to create it, then jira will check if "jira-users" group exists *in the cache* and will try to add newly created user to the non-existent group on the remote ldap server. As group does not really exist an exception will be thrown. Normally if group does not exist jira creates it first.

Operations that modifies ldap should not rely on cached data at all and always use up to date information from the remote ldap server.
fields.summary: LDAP issues during user creation / modification

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42082].
  {panel}

At the moment, user will not received any notification if Collaborator is engaged with any Service Desk issue.

The desired behaviour is to notify user when Collaborator performs the following actions:

* View issues, comments and attachments
* Add attachments and delete their own attachments
* Add internal comments to issues and delete their own comments
* Watch and vote for issues
fields.summary: Notify user when Collaborator is engaged in Service Desk issue

fields.description:
Issues created on other nodes while one node is performing a foreground re-index will ultimately be lost from the index after the re-index operation is complete.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Setup a JDC environment with at least 2 nodes
# Remove one of the nodes from the load balancer (so it is not accessible by normal users)
# Initiate a foreground re-index on the node you removed from the load balancer
# While the foreground re-index is in progress, create and update several issues on the other nodes(s) which are still in the load balancer and available to users
# Wait for the foreground re-index to complete, and for the new index to be completely replicated to all other nodes in the cluster
# Use the Issue Navigator (in List Mode, so it displays information from the index) to search for the issues you created and updated, and observe:
## Whether or not the issues appear in the search results
## What the last updated date/time is
## If the updates you made are reflected in the search results

h4. Workaround

Run a full reindex during an outage window, and offline all of the other nodes while it runs, to prevent any possibility this will be encountered.
fields.summary: Issues updated or created on one node while another node is performing a re-index do not get indexed

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42076].
  {panel}

There is a minor bug in JIRA's "What's New" dialog which states:

"""
    1. Spend time where it counts
    
        Developers can spend time doing what they love: writing code.
        * ...
        * Up-to-date status means *less* interruptions for status updates

"""

Since "interruption" is a countable noun, the correct English grammar would be:

        * Up-to-date status means *fewer* interruptions for status updates
fields.summary: Change the text in the "What's New in JIRA" dialog

h4. Problem statement
Hovering the mouse over the Date Time system field will not get rendered properly, it shows unicodes for the following fields
* Created
* Updated

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Start up JIRA 6.3.12
# Create DEMO project
# Download Russian's translation pack https://translations.atlassian.com/dashboard/download#/JIRA/6.3.12
# Change language to Russian
# Go to DEMO-1 and hover the mouse on Created/Updated field

h4. Screenshots
* Created/Updated System Field
!notworking.png!
* Date time custom field
!working.png!

h4. Expected behaviour
Expecting the result for the System field to be similar to what it is for Custom field.

h4. Additional Information
Hovering on the date and time of the comment shows the correct results in rendering the date and time.

Hello there!

In first, i want to clarify why th mention templates is imposible to customize (HTML)?
I'm attach file with code and with message example please help me to understand, where is my mistakes?

In second i need to understand why the @mention events do not handled by listeners? For example: don't need to send a @mention with special issue types, i already used the @user in comments field, and system run the comment event, with my custom template. I don't need to receive a @mention notification (personal), i need to receive only notification according comment event. (i need to receive only 1 notification). Possible to deactivate the mention notifications, but the @ function must stay in comments exactly to choose users.

In third, i need to split comment event notification into 2,3 events, which sended to users setted with @ in comments. If user, which setted with @ in comments is already in my custom field (A) (user picker), i need to send the comment notification template A, or user which setted with @ in comments is already in my custom field (B) (user picker), i need to send the comment notification template B. Example in attach.

fields.description:
Wrong timezone applied to issue history.

My user's timezone is set to +10.  It used to be +8, but I several months ago I changed it.

Today I created an issue and then immediately marked it as 'in progress'  This is what the history tab shows:

!times.png!

It shows the issue created at 8:12 AM.  It then shows the field change at 6:12 AM.  If I mouse-over the time, it shows a tooltip of 8:12 AM.
fields.summary: Wrong timezone applied to issue history

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42063].
  {panel}

Hi,

I am Atlassian Verified vendor and developer of a couple of JIRA add-ons.
I am facing a strange error which bothers me and some of my customers more than a year. A customer raised a [support ticket|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/REL-6], and finally they told me to raise an issue here indicating the reproducing steps.

Customers are getting below exception when two plugins installed at the same time.
{code}
Caused by: org.springframework.beans.factory.NoSuchBeanDefinitionException: No unique bean of type [com.atlassian.jira.config.StatusManager] is defined: Unsatisfied dependency of type [interface com.atlassian.jira.config.StatusManager]: expected at least 1 matching bean
{code}

Here are the steps to reproduce problem :
- Install JIRA
- Install plugin  [Issue Alternative Assignee|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.iamhuy.jira.plugin.issue-alternative-assignee]
- Install plugin [Time to SLA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/plugin.tts]
- Reboot JIRA
- Create custom field "Overdue Status" which comes with Time to SLA
- Go to configuration page of custom field (click actions icon, then select Configure in custom fields listing)
- Click "Edit Including SLAs" link, Ooops 404, and the stack trace is attached at the bottom of this issue.

Finally I found the root cause of the issue. Both plugins has class named {{EditConfiguration}} and they are both extending {{AbstractEditConfigurationItemAction}}

{code}
class EditConfiguration extends AbstractEditConfigurationItemAction {
 ...
}
{code}

When I change the class name to be any value except {{EditConfiguration}} it works.

As a work around I'm gonna change all class names, but I think it will be great to fix this problem in JIRA API because all tutorials are telling to use {{EditConfiguration}} class name :)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42056].
  {panel}

It seems that it is currently not possible to update a  custom field (in this case a check box field) with multiple choices. 

Let's say for example a check box field has 2 choices; First and Second. The Post Function is only capable of updating the field to either First or Second; not both. Using 2 Post Function will only result in the later overwriting the value of the first Post Function. 

When you attempt to update the field with the value 'First, Second' (this is the value shown on the issue view screen if both check boxes are ticked); the  transition fails.

It will be nice if the post function is capable of updating the check box field (or any other fields with similar characteristics) with multiple values instead of only 1.
fields.summary: Post Function Update Custom Field should be capable of updating checkboxes with multiple choices

fields.description:
Date time information in JIRA does not include time zone information when connected to MySQL.
Consequently, if the customer changes time zone, or if a server is moved to another timezone (e.g. from UTC to UTC-6), then all the dates prior to the change will be different in spite of the time zone settings in JIRA (in the prior example, all dates would be 6 hours in the future).
*Although this is a limitation from MySQL, since we do support this database, we should ensure time zone information is properly stored even when customers have to change their time zones, as this is a very common scenario for multinational companies and [daylight saving|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daylight_saving_time] countries.*

A possible alternative to address this (as per [this article|http://www.webdevelopersdiary.com/blog/good-to-know-how-to-properly-store-date-and-time-values-in-mysql] would be to store all times on MySQL DATETIME columns in UTC and apply the time zone according to JIRA's and the users time zone settings. However, I am not sure if this is feasible to be implemented above the OfBiz layer.
fields.summary: JIRA Cannot Handle Time Zone in MySQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42037].
  {panel}

Issue key has been used to communicate about issue's progress and status. And at the moment, subtasks issue type and parent issue type follow the same pattern of issue key. 

It would be useful if Subtask sequence number could be added as JIRA field, so it will be filterable in issue navigator. This will ease the user to refer to the subtask. Perhaps using the combination of (parent issuekey)-(subtask sequence number)
(i)Sequence number refers to the sequence number of subtask shown in the parent issue.

The following could be useful if implemented:
# save the sequence number of a sub-task as a JIRA field so that this can be displayed as a column. OR
# allow searching and quick search for sub-tasks with the syntax (parent issuekey)-(sequence number)
fields.summary: Adding Subtask sequence number as JIRA field to be filterable in Issue navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42036].
  {panel}

When transit an issue to another state, we refer to the following transition ID found in the GET method JSON.

For example:
# GET http://localhost:8080/rest/api/latest/issue/TEST-1/transitions
# The request returns the states 'Resolved' => '5', 'Closed' => '6', 'In Progress' => '3'. 
# POST http://localhost:8080/rest/api/latest/issue/TEST-1/transitions
{code}
{"transition":{"id":"7"}}
{code}
# This time with JSON data {"transition":{"id":"7"}} and get the '500 Internal Server Error' because transition ID = 7 is not exist.
{code}
2015-01-21 17:54:29,343 http-bio-8080-exec-20 ERROR admin 1134x2089x1 xxxx xx.xx.xx.xx /rest/api/latest/issue/TEST-1/transitions [jira.rest.exception.ExceptionInterceptor] Returning internal server error in response
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$ResponseOutInvoker$1.invoke(DispatchProviderHelper.java:234)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$1.intercept(DispatchProviderHelper.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DefaultMethodInvocation.invoke(DefaultMethodInvocation.java:61)
...
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.WorkflowActionsBean.getFieldScreenForView(WorkflowActionsBean.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.StandardFieldScreenRendererFactory.getScreenFromAction(StandardFieldScreenRendererFactory.java:130)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.StandardFieldScreenRendererFactory.createFieldScreenRenderer(StandardFieldScreenRendererFactory.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.FieldScreenRendererFactoryImpl.getFieldScreenRenderer(FieldScreenRendererFactoryImpl.java:55)
{code}

The NPE error is misleading to user and it would be great if JIRA can handle the error by showing a meaningful error message. Besides being misleading it seems to indicate that there is a bug in the error handling routines, and IMHO should be fixed.
fields.summary: JIRA REST API returned a NPE error if stated wrong transition ID

fields.description:
After using the "Back" button on the browser, the URL displays the previous issues but the screen remains on the same page.

*Steps to reproduce*
Search for any issue containing a sub-task in the Issue Navigator (List View mode)
Click on the issue. (example URL: http://127.0.0.1:8080/browse/TST-1?jql=)
On the View Issue screen click on the sub-task. (example URL: http://127.0.0.1:8080/browse/TST-2)
Hit the Back button on your browser.

*Expected behaviour*
JIRA should display the parent task.

*Actual behaviour*
The URL changes to the previous (http://127.0.0.1:8080/browse/TST-1?jql= in the example) but the screen remains on the sub-task.

*Finding*
This behaviour affects the linking issue as well.

*Temporary Workaround*
Refresh the page.
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't redirect issue when using the "Back" button

  {panel}

Although the following documentation mention MySQL to be supported, the two most common flavors of MySQL are not specifically listed as ones that likely will cause issues.
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+MySQL

MariaDB and Percona are proven to cause problems with JIRA and we have open feature requests to support those (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-42012, https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-32347), but since the documentation do not specifically mention they are not supported, in many cases users will make the assumption they are okay to use.
fields.summary: Documentation request: mention not supported flavors of MySQL

What do you think guys?

h4. Background
If a customer send an email to create issue or add a comment to an issue, sometimes JIRA failed to process the email, maybe due to the Permission or even the configuration itself. At the moment, JIRA did not inform the sender that the sent email failed to be added into JIRA.

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Do not (/) the *Create User* option, and leave *Default Assignee* empty
# Fill in the *Forward Email* field, so that any failed email will be notified to the Forward Email account
# Send an email to the Mail Handler

h4. Expected result
Both *Forward Email* and email sender are notified by JIRA

h4. Actual result
Only *Forward Email* account is notified of the problem

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When installing Jira Server or Data center to a linux operating system using the .bin installation package, Jira's is unable to setup a service for Jira to startup automatically on newer operating systems that utilize systemd.
h3. Environment
 * Linux OS (including but not limited to Redhat, Ubuntu, Debian, Arch Linux, CentOS, openSUSE, etc)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira using the .bin installation package to an OS such as Ubuntu 15.04+ OR CentOS 7.14.04+

h3. Expected Results

Expecting that Jira can automatically be installed as a system service to start when the host operating system starts.
h3. Actual Results

Jira will not start up automatically when installed
h3. Notes

The installation package is using a sysv script to attempt to install a service.  This could work for much older operating systems (say about 2014 and before), but these will not work for more modern linux OS.
h3. Workaround

Please see the KB in [Run Jira as a systemd service on linux - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/run-jira-as-a-systemd-service-on-linux-979411854.html] for steps on how you can set this up manually.

 

 
{panel:title=original description|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#3c7833|titleBGColor=#aaa|bgColor=#fff}
Right now we only have SysV startup scripts. As most major Linux distributions now use systemd, we should add these scripts. Filing as a bug and not suggestion because a user installing the binary on latest version of Linux will have broken functionality.

Note: Whoever handles this should likely just try and fix this for all products as the scripts would be very similar.
{panel}
fields.summary: Fix outdated startup scripts in linux binary installer

fields.description:
*steps to reproduce*
* Configure {{jira.search.views.default.max=-1}} for JIRA using jira-config.properties file
* Try to perform a search such as the following using JIRA's rest API: http://localhost:8080/rest/api/2/search?jql=project=CCR&maxResults=1

*expected results*
* Only one issue as specified in maxResults=1 is returned

*actual results*
* All the results matching the filter query are returned.
* Examining the returned JSON object you can see that maxResults value is registered as  maxResults=2147483647 instead of 1 which was sent in the request.

*other notes*
* setting {{jira.search.views.default.max}} to an actual limit (lower than or equal to the value of jira.search.views.max.limit ) e.g. 1000 or removing it's setting entirely actually resolves the problem. (This can be used as a workaround)
* According to [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Limiting+the+number+of+issues+returned+from+a+search+view+such+as+an+RSS+feed], {{jira.search.views.default.max}} is defined as a default soft limit for maximum number of issues to be retrieved, it seems to be acting like a hard limit on the number of issues returned here. Note that even when maxResults is lower than the configured jira.search.views.default.max, it is still ignored.
fields.summary: Setting jira.search.views.default.max to -1 breaks maxResults parameter in JIRA rest api's rest/api/2/search
